column32: At least in the archaeology of Southern Pampean Hills (CÃ³rdoba, Argentina) there is not a consensus about periods that summarize the history of prehispanic populations. The result is a large list of different periods or/and temporal categories produced by many archaeologist, in consequence is confusing understand the local archaeological past, because two different periods can alude to the same event.
